context_analysis.email_summary: Katie responded about soil carbon paper - suggests SOIL or Geoderma journal after editing. Need to respond (15min task).
calendar_conflicts: 08:00-08:15 Paige meeting will delay morning departure
context_analysis.energy_patterns: Energy level 7/10 - good capacity for focused work. Planning 4:15pm gym departure suggests managing energy through exercise break.
strategic_priorities: Start horizons run for overnight processing
time_constraints: Late 8:30am departure due to Paige meeting
Need to start horizons run immediately when home (~6:15pm)

reasoning.scheduling_strategy: Front-load high-cognitive tasks (Geoderma Review response, MAOM-N edits) in morning peak hours. Schedule Ensemble MS writing after AI-LEAF meeting when focus returns. Place echo analytics work in early afternoon when energy may dip slightly. Quick horizons setup before leaving.
reasoning.energy_optimization: With energy at 7/10, can handle substantial cognitive work but need strategic breaks. Morning block for critical review work, mid-morning meeting provides natural break, then deep writing work. Afternoon technical tasks when energy naturally lower. Gym at 4:15pm will restore energy for evening horizons setup.
reasoning.priority_sequencing: 1) Katie's response first (quick win, clears mental space), 2) MAOM-N edits while fresh, 3) Ensemble Methods writing post-meeting, 4) Echo analytics and Margenot email in afternoon, 5) Horizons prep before leaving
reasoning.recovery_planning: Built-in recovery through meeting transitions and lunch break. Gym session at 4:15pm provides physical reset. Evening kept light - just horizons setup and cooking. Avoiding overcommitment given last week was slow and tomorrow needs to be catch-up day.

narrative.summary: I've structured your day to maximize that solid energy level of 7 while respecting your late start and early departure. Given that finishing the Geoderma Review is your top priority, I've front-loaded the response to Katie and the MAOM-N edits in your morning peak hours - you'll knock out Katie's response first thing to clear that mental tab, then dive into the substantive editing work while your focus is sharpest. The AI-LEAF meeting actually works well as a natural break before your deep writing session on the Ensemble Methods. I've placed the echo analytics work and Margenot email draft in the early afternoon when your energy might naturally dip a bit - these tasks require focus but perhaps less creative heavy lifting than the morning's writing work. The horizons setup is perfectly positioned at the end of your workday so you can get it running as soon as you get home. This schedule respects your need to catch up after a slow week while not overextending yourself before tomorrow's heavier day.

questions.question: Would you prefer to draft the Margenot email earlier in the day while your writing energy is higher, or is afternoon placement okay?
questions.context: Email drafting can benefit from morning clarity but current placement allows uninterrupted morning research focus

key_insights: Front-loaded Geoderma Review tasks during peak morning energy
Strategic use of AI-LEAF meeting as cognitive break between intensive tasks
Shortened echo analytics time to accommodate schedule constraints
Horizons run positioned for immediate evening start and overnight processing
Built recovery time through gym session and relaxed evening
